column5: morning all woke to the weather man here saying we got 64cm and maybe 20cm more to come.it's going to be a long day.everything is closed and buses pulled.when they don't run you know its bad.well back to shovelling.jamie
There some great pics from the London area in another thread....  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=1130  64cm and 20 more??? WOW!!!  At least you get a long weekend
Can you imagine how many army guys it would take for Toronto to deal with 64 cm!!!??!!?? LOL! Maybe we should send Mel Lastman to the London area to help out!!! HH

wow thats a lot of snow! I actually like when we get heavy snowfalls, i mean like the London area just got. I dont drive so doesnt bother me, i lovvee snow, ever since i was a kid and still do. Here in Toronto we dont get much, but im hoping well get some soon. I wanna wake up and open the door and have snow pouring in
my folks live 10k outside of the city of London Limits and they got none of that snow.  It was a really localized streamer.  Nuts.

Yeah I have family in Kitchener and they didn't get anything.  How long are we going to have to wait in the Toronto area to get a nice blanket of snow on the ground?  It is starting to seem like we are never going to get it.  Mother natures keeps teasing us.  We had the cold weather this week and now it looks as though things are gonna warm up a bit for next.  I wonder when we are going to be able to get out on the ice.  The sudbury guys are already saying they may be out by the weekend.

I live about 15 mins. NE of London Airport. We got about 1/2 or slightly less snow than reported in London. As it was light fluffy snow I was able to drive through it to go to work in Stratford today. If it would have been wet heavey snow I would have not even considered trying it.  Best Wishes: Rick
